basics.name: Hank McLaughlin
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: Senior Principal Mobile Engineer at Mindgrub. Responsible for design, architecture, and maintenance of native mobile android, and iOS applications. As well as mentorship and support of junior developers

work.summary: Developing software for iOS and Android, as well as functioning as a technical lead, making architecture decisions at the early stages of projects, and reviewing code and providing support as projects continue.
highlights: Architect, build, and ship applications for clients like Exelon, MD Lottery, Idaho Power, and many more.
Meet with clients to understand product vision and consult on new technology and how to leverage it for success.
Provide support for devs working on my project, helping with blockers, or reviewing code
Mentoring junior devs on best practices, and new technology

work.summary: Architect, build, and maintain the Leafly Android and iOS apps. Adding new features and capabilities to peoples shopping experience. As well as mentoring junior engineers
highlights: Totally re-architect the android app and rewrite the app in flight over the course of a year (project Theseus)
Design, build, and code a system that allows for easy re-ordering of product from dispensaries
Build a system that acts as a kiosk for customers within dispensaries
Architected a system that indexes strains locally on devices so that those results can appear in native global search systems (plus Siri and google assistant)

work.summary: Invent and prototype potential future hardware and software products. As well as present them to upper management
highlights: Design, build, and code a system that bridges Zigbee and Zwave IOT networks
Build a system that pilots heavy machinery based off of openCV video input
Design build and ship a system that locates tools indoors, and on job sites

work.summary: Manage a team of 7 engineers and 3 interns, as well as architect and implement native mobile and web applications using the latest technology and methodologies
highlights: Architect, build, and ship applications for clients like MD Lottery, Under Armour, Wendy's, and many more.
Meet with clients to understand product vision and consult on new technology and how to leverage it for success.
Successfully transitioned the team from a waterfall structure to agile processes with constant feedback and improvement
Promoted the creation of automation software internally, to create a more efficient, less stressful work environment

volunteer.summary: Spend a day in a local classroom every year teaching middle and highschool students to code using Scratch, and robotics fro Sphero
Provide career advice and mentorship to Towson University students at a few events every year, ranging from coding tutorials to career workshops
